meanings.definition: A line on a map connecting points of equal value.
meanings.sent1: The isoline on the map shows where the temperature is the same.
meanings.sent2: I followed the isoline to find the area with the same elevation.
meanings.sent3: The isoline on the map looked like a squiggly snake!
meanings.sent4: The isoline acted as a border between the high and low pressure systems.
meanings.sent5: The isoline helped me visualize the areas with similar rainfall.

meanings.definition: To represent data on a map using isolines.
meanings.sent1: She decided to isoline the data to make it easier to understand.
meanings.sent2: The scientist isolined the information to create a clearer picture.
meanings.sent3: I tried to isoline the map, but it ended up looking like a mess!
meanings.sent4: By isolining the data, we could see the patterns more clearly.
meanings.sent5: Isolining the map helped us see where the trends were strongest.
